pageContext.claim: “Do you remember they were trying to take ‘Christmas’ out of Christmas? Do you remember? They didn't want to let you say ‘Merry Christmas.’ You would go around, you'd see department stores that have everything -- red, snow, beautiful ribbons, bows -- everything was there, but they wouldn't say ‘Merry Christmas.’ They're all saying ‘Merry Christmas’ again.”
pageContext.analysis: This claim is a strange favorite of the president's. There is no evidence that stores stopped using Merry Christmas in their advertising, were "ashamed" to do so or that any of this changed since Trump took office.
